intro: Poa scaberula var. gracillima, commonly known as the slender meadow grass, is a variant of the meadow grass species native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a low-growing perennial grass characterized by its fine, tufted foliage and slender, upright stems. The plant typically thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along riverbanks. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, with a distinctive bluish-green hue. The inflorescence consists of a loose panicle of spikelets, which produce small, wind-pollinated flowers.
